main event: Several unidentified objects were spotted in the sky over Lakewood, Arkansas in 1964.
interesting points: The objects were described as being roughly egg-shaped, about a quarter the size of a C-130 Hercules transport aircraft, and luminous in appearance.
The initial object appeared to break into two pieces, and then one of those pieces seemed to break into two again.
The objects displayed erratic motion, going from stationary to moving in a southeasterly direction before disappearing.
The sighting lasted for approximately 5 minutes and was observed through field glasses by a witness on the ground.
The Air Force investigator believed the sighting was likely caused by sunlight reflecting off the aircraft, creating an illusion of multiple solid objects.
witnesses: at least one witness on the ground
